answers.answer: Liver disease can cause elevated CA-125 levels.

Thank You.  Her GI doctor says all her tests are coming back normal for everything but cirrohus.  The gyn/onco said the ascities was coming from one of 4 things.  Either her kidneys (which he ruled out because the dialysis should be taking care of it)her liver; he has ruled out according to the test relults from the GI doctor.  Her heart; but he didnt feel it was this due to  her not being terribly short of breath, but sent her for an evaluation anyway.  The last thing was Ovarian Cancer.  I just feel everyone is running all these tests and I am not getting anyone to tell me what is going on.

I am sorry to say this but it is possible that no one knows exactly what is happening.  The human body is a complex "machine" and the failure of  one organ  affects the entire body.  The situation is made worse when more than one organ is not functioning properly.   Additionally, the medications and treatments given to control one condition can cause or agravate other conditions; yet, without that treatment or that medication, death would surely come sooner.   Sometimes medical care is a difficult balance between hard choices.I can understand your frustrations and fears; I took care of my grandmother during her last few years when her mind and body began to fail her.  Sometimes even the best care in the world seems to be of little help.

question: My mother is 69 years old.  She is a below the knee amputee of both legs from diabetes.  She had heart by-pass in Dec of 2003.  In Feb of 2004 she entered into End stage renal Disease and now goes to dialysis 3 times a week; 4 hours a day.  In Dec she was diagnosed with Acities.  Since Dec 17, 2004 she has had 22 liters of fluid removed from her stomach.  She was in the hospital for a week and had a battery of tests run where they discovered her cirrohus of liver and her UTI infection.  They sent her home.  Her GI dr called me one evening to tell me of her elevated CA125 test and sent her to a gyn/onc the next morning.  The Gyn told us a CA125 was over 300; had her stomach drained again and analyzed (fluid); and making the cardiologist look at her to rule out the heart.  She has since had alot of diarrhea and many, many messes.  We see the cardiologist today; but dont go back to gyn/onc til the 25th. I am scared stiff and I feel that I am getting no answers.  She has days where she is just in lala land and days where she is here on earth with me.  I have quit my job to stay home with her; but I feel like to much time is passing in between appointments before I get what few answers I need.  Could someone help me here?  Should I demand earlier appointments and what questions do I need to be asking?
title: Lost and Alone
